Hey, @Joshua Nelson, @simulacrum, @Eric Huss, @bjorn3 , I've put together a document listing pros and cons of moving/library to a workspace:

https://hackmd.io/n_VQ6h7LRhu_VAgviwcvnQ?view
I intend this to act as a sort-of pre-MCP, as there was some pushback against the idea

I am interested in this from two angles:

  • I feel that long-term this is the right thing to do to make the overall rust build more boring
  • Short term, I think this could help IDEs with analysis of standard library, as currently IDEs can't really distinguish between stdlib crates and compiler crates
I remain neutral on this, I think it could be good but I don't personally have bandwidth to push it forward. Thanks for writing up the doc!
